overview: Obadiah, the shortest book in the Old Testament, pronounces judgment on Edom for their hostility toward Israel. It demonstrates that God judges nations who harm His people.

verses.text: For the day of the LORD is near upon all the nations. As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.

The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your lofty dwelling, who say in your heart, 'Who will bring me down to the ground?' Though you soar aloft like the eagle, though your nest is set among the stars, from there I will bring you down, declares the LORD.

passages.title: Edom's Pride and Fall
passages.summary: Edom trusted in their mountain fortress, but God would bring them down because of their pride and betrayal of Israel.

facts.text: Obadiah is the shortest book in the Old Testament with just 21 verses.
The Edomites were descendants of Esau, Jacob's brother, making their hostility toward Israel a family feud spanning centuries.
Edom's capital Petra was carved into cliffs, making them feel invincibleâ€”but they fell completely.

figures.name: Obadiah
figures.description: A prophet whose name means 'servant of the LORD,' delivering God's verdict against Edom. Little else is known about him.

videos.title: Obadiah Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores this brief prophecy against Edom.
